comment: GG is great and give tons of extra credit.

Professor GG is a really great professor. She cares about her students, so much so that she basically learned everyone's names by the second class. We had 3 homework assignments, two tests and a final. She also allowed us to have 3 full size, back and front notes sheet for the 2 tests but not the final (because its a department final).

GG is a really good professor. Does her best to make all topics are understood and that labs are informative while also pretty easy and fun to do. Gives very little assignments and hates giving out bad grade so as long as you put effort into work / labs , you will be fine. Would 100% take her again if I could.
Really enthusiastic professor. She is caring and makes her lectures dynamic, interesting and fun. She gives extra credit and is an easy grader. Tests are long but easy.

GG is awesome, she's the best professor I've had. Maybe a bit unorganized at times but she is very personable and is always happy to answer questions. She also cares a lot more about teaching than she does about your grade, show that you are putting in effort and you will do well.

GG is a little unorganized, but she will own up to her mistakes. She is one of the sweetest professors I've met, and her strengths lab is incredibly easy. You do write group lab reports, so do choose a good group. Her grading is very lenient though, so the papers were super easy. She's also great at explaining theory before the lab!

Great professor. Her teaching style matched my learning style. I know from other students that it is not for everyone. She gives a lot of extra credit for in-class participation, not just attendance. She teaches from slides from a textbook which she cannot give to the students due to some copyright stuff, so it is key that you go to class.

She's a great professor. Her powerpoints are from the textbook so you can't access them, so in a way attendance is mandatory. She's easy going. Her exams are problem based so you have to do calculations to get the answer. The exams have 4 questions. You're allowed one cheat sheet. In conclusion, make sure to know your stuff.
One of the best professors I've ever had.
